intro: Sisymbrium stigmatosum, commonly known as the eastern wallflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and alternate leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its fruits are dry pods that dehisce to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in the Brassicaceae family. Sisymbrium stigmatosum is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun.
